channel.title: String Samples?
channel.description: Hey guys! I have a random question... I really need strings in my tracks (and Auxy doesn’t have strings yet), and I’m wondering if someone could recommend some good string samples for me? I know this is what Google is for, but I was having trouble for some reason finding the right stuff. Thanks!

item.title: String Samples?
item.dc:creator: Cheddr
item.description:
I made a playlist:
https://soundcloud.com/cheddr/sets/strings-and-classical-fusion
Soundcloud comments also were added to highlight sections

Read full topic

item.title: String Samples?

item.description:
What songs exactly? Just curious.

Read full topic

item.title: String Samples?
item.dc:creator: Cheddr
item.description:
Layers help with the chorusing. @BALLISTIK is right, it’s important. Modulating volume, tone, or eq randomly and individually helps it sound more natural too. I like the reverb up when doing this as well.

I like to put bow, runner, and story together to sound like an orchestra.

Be sure to use low octaves for bow.
Story to me sounds like brass instruments. There are others for brass, but I can’t remember which.
June for high woodwinds like flutes and clarinets.
Others that could be mixed in are otter, strain, jelly, silk.

A lot of my songs have strings. Runner is my go to to usually for that.

https://app.auxy.co/projects/83dRmi_CfvlblmD6DaYmPw==

Read full topic

item.title: String Samples?
item.dc:creator: TC64
item.description:
You can kinda use Runner as a string sound, with just the right tweaks and enough instruments to blend it in with: Open in Auxy

Read full topic

item.title: String Samples?
item.dc:creator: BALLISTIK
item.description:
Yeah but the problem is that it doesn’t have a really good chorusing effect, which is what makes an orchestra sound like an orchestra.

Read full topic

item.title: String Samples?
item.dc:creator: BALLISTIK
item.description:
Logic Pro X has pretty good strings, but sadly they’re not accessible unless you buy LPX for $200. GarageBand for iOS has pretty realistic sounding ones, but they are a little overused, and it is much easier to do chords than actual melodies. Overall, honestly you get what you pay for.

Read full topic

item.title: String Samples?
item.dc:creator: Sunny
item.description:
Boldt strings for Garageband were nice. Been a while since I visited the download site, but might still be floating around.

Read full topic

item.title: String Samples?
item.dc:creator: iammane
item.description:
Depending on what you’re doing, the string sounds in Garageband on iOS are serviceable.

If you’re looking for a full on orchestra or looking to have a string solo then pass on this, you’ll want samples. Otherwise, this might fit the bill

Read full topic
